subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Consciousness: The Hard Problem
description: A quick win: understand Consciousness: The Hard Problem.

hook.text: Science can map every neuron in your brain. It still can't explain why you feel anything. Consciousness is a mystery.

buildup.text: Philosopher David Chalmers calls it the 'hard problem.' We know how brains work but not why they produce experience.

discovery.text: Materialists say consciousness is just brain activity. Dualists say mind is separate from matter. Neither has proof.

twist.text: Some scientists are turning to panpsychism: consciousness is in everything. That sounds oddly like Hindu Brahman.

climax.text: Consciousness may be where science and religion meet. Both are asking the same question with different languages.

punchline.text: Science can map the brain. It can't explain why you feel. The mystery stands.

quiz.question: What is the 'hard problem' of consciousness?
options: Explaining why brain activity produces subjective experience
